column2: Which of the following property of splay tree is correct?
column3: it holds probability usage of the respective sub trees
column4: any sequence of j operations starting from an empty tree with h nodes atmost, takes O(jlogh) time complexity
column5: sequence of operations with h nodes can take O(logh) time complexity
easier to program and faster access to recently accessed items

column3: moving parent node to down of child

column2: Which of the following options is an application of splay trees?
When we have red-black trees and AVL trees that can perform most of operations in logarithmic times, then what is the need for splay trees?
column3: no there is no special usage
column4: In real time it is estimated that 80% access is only to 20% data, hence most used ones must be easily available
column5: redblack and avl are not upto mark
column6: they are just another type of self balancing binary search trees
